geneVariantDescriptions.description: PIK3CA E542X indicates any Pik3ca missense mutation which results in the glutamic acid (E) at amino acid 542 being replaced by a different amino acid.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a Phase II trial, the presence of PIK3CA activating mutations including E542X, E545X, and H1047X correlated with shorter progression-free survival (2.66 months) compared to PIK3CA wild-type or other mutations (4.24 month, HR=1.68, p=0.033) in patients with metastatic Erbb2 (Her2)-positive (amplification or overexpression) breast cancer treated with Poziotinib (HM781-36B) (PMID: 30720867, NCT02418689).

references.title: Molecular alterations and poziotinib efficacy, a pan-HER inhibitor, in human epidermal growth factor receptor 2 (HER2)-positive breast cancers: Combined exploratory biomarker analysis from a phase II clinical trial of poziotinib for refractory HER2-positive breast cancer patients.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a Phase II trial, the presence of PIK3CA activating mutations including E542X, E545X, and H1047X correlated with shorter progression-free survival (2.66 months) compared to PIK3CA wild-type or other mutations (4.24 month, HR=1.68, p=0.033) in patients with metastatic Erbb2 (Her2)-positive (amplification or overexpression) breast cancer treated with Poziotinib (HM781-36B) (PMID: 30720867, NCT02418689).

references.title: Molecular alterations and poziotinib efficacy, a pan-HER inhibitor, in human epidermal growth factor receptor 2 (HER2)-positive breast cancers: Combined exploratory biomarker analysis from a phase II clinical trial of poziotinib for refractory HER2-positive breast cancer patients.
